fields.value: Bactris gasipaes (peach palm) progeny test fruit data

dsDescriptionValue.value: The data set consists of fruiting data from two randomized complete block provenance-progeny trials (‘97’ and ‘99’) of the Pampa Hermosa population (near Yurimaguas, Peru) of the Amazonian domesticated palm species Bactris gasipaes. See Notes for variables etc.

fields.value:
Each of the 9906 lines of data consists of values for the following identification and measurement for a single individual plant. 
Identification variables
ORDER: Consecutive line numbering for the data set when ordered hierarchically by COLLECTION / LOCATION / BLOCK / PLOT / POSITION
COLLECTION: Specifies the collection year (1997 or 1999). These also correspond to the two different experiments. All other identification variables are specific to the collection / experiment in question, e.g. Block 1 of Collection 97 is NOT the same entity as Block 1 of Collection 99 (ditto for the families).
LOCATION: Location of the block in question (Ucayali or Yurimaguas). Collection / Experiment 97 was planted in both Ucayali and Yurimaguas, whereas Collection / Experiment 99 was planted only in Ucayali
BLOCK: Specifies the experimental block. Block numbers are non-unique, i.e. nested within each Collection / Location combination
PLOT: Plot number within each block. There were two trees per plot/family per block.
FAM: Number of the family (i.e. open-pollinated progeny of a single mother-tree). Family numbers are not unique, i.e. are nested within each collection: Family x (Collection 97) is not the same as Family x (Collection 99), where x is constant.
Measurement variables
Each variable name follows the same format:
NAME_XXm_Y
where NAME = the attribute measured or observed
XXm refers to measurement age in months (e.g. 57m = 57 months)
Y = the measurement occasion (fruit variables were measured >1 times in a given month)
Variable names are defined below:

NTR: total number of racemes
LRM: length of mature racemes (cm)
ARM: width of mature racemes (cm)
PRM: mass of mature racemes (kg)
PTF: total mass of fruit per mature raceme (g)
NTF: number of fruit per mature raceme
NTFCS: number of mature fruit per mature raceme
PTFCS: total mass of mature fruit per mature raceme (g)
LFM: length of each of 10 mature fruits (mm)

Blank cells indicate no fruit production.

files.label: Bactris gasipaes Progeny Test Fruit Data_Dataverse.xls
